caption.p: HIV transmission Markov model. For each underlying population, a Markov chain is considered with the state space, consisting of the six states: (1) HIV-; (2) HIV+ undiagnosed; (3) HIV+ diagnosed pre-ART; (4) HIV+ diagnosed on ART with viral suppression; (5) HIV+ diagnosed on ART with virological failure; and (6) death. State (5) represents a setting where viral suppression is not achieved under the current ART regimen, or where individuals discontinued ART for the duration of the 3-month cycle. ART, antiretroviral therapy; ‘+’, positive; ‘-’, negative.
